span.strong: All schools closed through the end of the year for 2019-20.

a.title: Free Grab and Go Meals Spanish

img.alt: Free Grab and Go Meals Spanish

div.div: Follow the links to each school's online resource page. Please check in frequently as we will continue to add links and resources in the coming weeks.

I want to start by thanking all of you for adapting to the changes resulting from school closure. There have been several times during the past week that we needed to change plans very quickly, in some cases after we had done extensive work to plan for another path we thought we were taking. So thank you for your understanding

This afternoon, Governor Inslee announced that all Washington schools would be closing by Tuesday, March 17, 2020 due to the coronavirus pandemic. Therefore, Elma Schools will have our last day with students on Monday March 16
div.a: Read More about Update on Statewide School Closure

div.p:
Greetings parents and neighbors,
I want to extend a warm welcome to you as we begin the 2019-20 school year. We hope that this year will be the most successful ever for our district. As that is our aim, I want to share with you how we plan to make this year our best ever.
Collaborative teaming: From the top level of our district (the school board) to each and every person who works here we will be working together to bring success to all our students. Research tells us this is the most effective single strategy to ensure all students achieve success. Which for us means all students at or above grade level in reading and math.
Service: Our admin team has decided to make service our focus for the year. Service is at the heart of who we want to be as leaders, and we will challenge ourselves to act on this desire. We thank you for allowing us to serve you.
Communication: We have improved in this area, but it continues to be an area of focus as there are so many successes as well as challenges we would like to share, it can become confusing and not as timely as we would like. Thank you for letting us know how we can become better in this area.
Learning: Our mission is: Engage, Learn, Motivate, Achieve. These words are at the core of what we do daily. We will always keep our eyes on the prize, which is learning for all.
We are looking forward to the year ahead. We truly love our work, and we hope that is evident by the way we do our jobs every day.
Kevin Acuff
Superintendent

div.p: Elma School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee(s) has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights and Title IX Coordinator: Kevin Acuff, 360-482-2822, kacuff@eagles.edu; and 504 Coordinator: Stacey Rockey, 360-482-1123, srockey@eagles.edu. Address: 1235 Monte Elma Road, Elma, WA 98541.
